actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Armed Services.
Reported to House from the Committee on Armed Services with amendment, H. Rept. 95-272 (Part I).

actions.committee: House Committee on Science and Technology
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Science and Technology.
Reported to House from the Committee on Science and Technology with amendment, H. Rept. 95-272 (Part II).
Measure called up by special rule in House.
Motion to recommit to the Committee on Armed Services rejected in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #609 (330-78).
Measure laid on table, S. 1339 passed in lieu.

official_title: A bill to authorize appropriations for the use of the Energy Research and Development Administration in accordance with section 261 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954, as amended, and section 305 of the Energy Reorganization Act of 1974.

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended, roll call #609 (330-78)) =Title I: For National Security Programs= - Authorizes the appropriation of $1,990,100,000 to the Energy Research and Development Administration for fiscal year 1978 for operating expenses for various national security programs. Lists specified amounts authorized for weapons activities, special materials production, laser fusion, naval reactor development and program management and support. Lists amounts authorized for specified plant and capital equipment expenditures. Amends prior year appropriations authorization acts to authorize increases for specified projects. =Title II: General Provisions= - Imposes limitations upon the amount of cost overrun incurred by projects authorized by this Act without specific Congressional authorization. Prohibits transfers and unauthorized expenditures of funds without prior notice to Congress with opportunity for Congressional review.

titles.title: A bill to authorize appropriations for the use of the Energy Research and Development Administration in accordance with section 261 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954, as amended, and section 305 of the Energy Reorganization Act of 1974.
